content.statement: dvt-003-wells-score is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Deep-Vein-Thrombosis that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding dvt-003-wells-score helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of dvt-003-wells-score include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of dvt-003-wells-score.

definitions_glossary.pretest_probability: Likelihood of disease before diagnostic testing
definitions_glossary.clinical_prediction_rule: Algorithm using clinical features to estimate disease probability
definitions_glossary.d_dimer: Blood test for fibrin degradation products, elevated in clot
definitions_glossary.negative_predictive_value: Probability that negative test truly excludes disease
definitions_glossary.sensitivity: Proportion of diseased individuals correctly identified as positive

wells_criteria.criterion: Active cancer (treatment within 6 months or palliative)
Paralysis, paresis, or recent leg cast immobilization
Bedridden >3 days or major surgery <12 weeks requiring GA/regional
Localized tenderness along distribution of deep venous system
Calf swelling >3 cm compared to asymptomatic leg (measured 10 cm below tibial tuberosity)
Pitting edema confined to symptomatic leg
Alternative diagnosis at least as likely as DVT

dvt_likely.note: D-dimer not useful as first test

diagnostic_algorithm: If D-dimer positive OR Wells ≥2: Order ultrasound
If ultrasound negative and high suspicion: Repeat in 5-7 days or consider CT/MR venography

definition.@value: Clinical prediction rule to estimate pretest probability of DVT and guide diagnostic testing

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: List the components of the Wells Score for DVT
Calculate and interpret the Wells Score
Apply the score to guide diagnostic testing
Understand the role of D-dimer in low-probability patients
clinical_pearls: Alternative diagnosis as likely = -2 points (important for specificity)
Low Wells + negative D-dimer = DVT safely excluded
High Wells = go straight to ultrasound, skip D-dimer
D-dimer is sensitive but not specific - many false positives
